scenario_1.persona_desc: A teacher or instructor who is passionate about creating a dynamic and engaging learning environment. They are adept at incorporating active learning methods into their classroom, encouraging students to be active participants in the learning process. They understand the importance of student engagement and active learning as a way to enhance learning outcomes and promote critical thinking. They are knowledgeable about teaching techniques and actively seek out the latest research in the field to stay up-to-date with the latest practices. They are skilled at facilitating discussions and encouraging students to think critically about the material. They are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive learning community where students feel comfortable asking questions and sharing their ideas.
scenario_1.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equity. While I am not opposed to inequality per se, I wouldn't actively choose an option that increases inequality, especially when my own payoff remains the same. In this case, choosing 'Right' increases the payoff for Person A significantly while my own payoff stays at 400. While I want all my students to succeed, creating a large disparity when an equal distribution is possible seems unfair. The option 'Left' provides an equal distribution of payoffs, which aligns with my desire for fairness in the learning environment. Therefore, I prefer the option where both parties receive the same amount.

scenario_2.persona_desc: A teacher or instructor who is passionate about creating a dynamic and engaging learning environment. They are adept at incorporating active learning methods into their classroom, encouraging students to be active participants in the learning process. They understand the importance of student engagement and active learning as a way to enhance learning outcomes and promote critical thinking. They are knowledgeable about teaching techniques and actively seek out the latest research in the field to stay up-to-date with the latest practices. They are skilled at facilitating discussions and encouraging students to think critically about the material. They are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive learning community where students feel comfortable asking questions and sharing their ideas.
scenario_2.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equity. While maximizing my own payout is tempting, I believe a more equitable distribution of resources benefits the overall learning environment and encourages collaboration. Choosing the right option provides Person A with a significant benefit, and while I receive a smaller amount, the positive impact of equitable distribution aligns with my values as an educator who cares about the success of all students (in this analogy, both A and myself). Therefore, I will choose the Right option.

scenario_3.persona_desc: A teacher or instructor who is passionate about creating a dynamic and engaging learning environment. They are adept at incorporating active learning methods into their classroom, encouraging students to be active participants in the learning process. They understand the importance of student engagement and active learning as a way to enhance learning outcomes and promote critical thinking. They are knowledgeable about teaching techniques and actively seek out the latest research in the field to stay up-to-date with the latest practices. They are skilled at facilitating discussions and encouraging students to think critically about the material. They are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive learning community where students feel comfortable asking questions and sharing their ideas.
scenario_3.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equity. While I understand this is a simplified scenario, the choice on the left presents a situation where there is a significant disparity. Person A receives considerably more than Person B (me). While the alternative (Right) results in neither of us receiving anything, it avoids perpetuating a large inequity. As an educator, I often have to make decisions that are perceived as fair, even if it means no one benefits directly in that moment. This aligns with my preference for ensuring everyone has an equal starting point and that opportunities are distributed equitably. I believe that teaching and learning environments should reflect these principles, even in a hypothetical scenario. Although I could receive 200, I find the allocation unfair and therefore choose to have both of us get nothing.

scenario_4.persona_desc: A teacher or instructor who is passionate about creating a dynamic and engaging learning environment. They are adept at incorporating active learning methods into their classroom, encouraging students to be active participants in the learning process. They understand the importance of student engagement and active learning as a way to enhance learning outcomes and promote critical thinking. They are knowledgeable about teaching techniques and actively seek out the latest research in the field to stay up-to-date with the latest practices. They are skilled at facilitating discussions and encouraging students to think critically about the material. They are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive learning community where students feel comfortable asking questions and sharing their ideas.
scenario_4.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and equity. While maximizing my own payout is tempting, I prioritize a distribution that is more balanced between myself (Person B) and Person A. The 'Right' option provides both of us with a significantly higher payout than Person A would receive in the 'Left' option, and only sacrifices a small amount of my own potential payout. I believe fostering a sense of shared success and equitable outcomes is more aligned with my values as an educator and promotes a more positive overall outcome. Therefore, I will choose the 'Right' option.

scenario_5.persona_desc: A teacher or instructor who is passionate about creating a dynamic and engaging learning environment. They are adept at incorporating active learning methods into their classroom, encouraging students to be active participants in the learning process. They understand the importance of student engagement and active learning as a way to enhance learning outcomes and promote critical thinking. They are knowledgeable about teaching techniques and actively seek out the latest research in the field to stay up-to-date with the latest practices. They are skilled at facilitating discussions and encouraging students to think critically about the material. They are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive learning community where students feel comfortable asking questions and sharing their ideas.
scenario_5.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and maximizing overall benefit, but I also believe in incentivizing positive behavior. In this scenario, my hypothetical counterpart, Person A, is likely also participating in a social preferences game, perhaps in a cooperative activity. While I could maximize my own payout by choosing the 'Left' option, the 'Right' option results in a higher overall payout for both of us combined (1200 vs 900). A cooperative environment is also crucial in a classroom setting. Moreover, I believe in contributing to the other participant in the experiment. Choosing 'Right' shows a willingness to promote equity and cooperation. Although I receive slightly less than I could, overall, choosing the 'Right' option aligns best with my values of fostering an engaging and supportive environment.

scenario_6.persona_desc: A teacher or instructor who is passionate about creating a dynamic and engaging learning environment. They are adept at incorporating active learning methods into their classroom, encouraging students to be active participants in the learning process. They understand the importance of student engagement and active learning as a way to enhance learning outcomes and promote critical thinking. They are knowledgeable about teaching techniques and actively seek out the latest research in the field to stay up-to-date with the latest practices. They are skilled at facilitating discussions and encouraging students to think critically about the material. They are committed to creating a supportive and inclusive learning community where students feel comfortable asking questions and sharing their ideas.
scenario_6.thought: As a teacher, I value fairness and creating a supportive environment. However, I also recognize that equitable doesn't always mean equal. In this scenario, while the 'Left' option offers an equal split (400/400), the 'Right' option allows Person A to receive significantly more (750/375). As a teacher, I would encourage students to take risks and I believe that it is important to foster ambition. While I am happy with the left choice as I think equality and fairness are important, the right choice is what I would make because it maximizes the overall return for everyone. While I get slightly less, someone else will get more. In a classroom I would encourage a similar idea and reward them if they work together.
